TaskController.summary:
The TaskController interface of the Prioritized Task Scheduling API represents a controller object that can be used to both abort and change the priority of one or more prioritized tasks.
If there is no need to change task priorities, then can be used instead.

remarks.para:
A new TaskController instance is created using the constructor, optionally specifying a priority for its associated signal (a ).
If not specified, the signal will have a priority of "user-visible" by default.

The controller's signal can be passed as an argument to the method for one or more tasks.
For mutable tasks (only) the task is initialized with the signal priority, and can later be changed by calling .
For immutable tasks, any priority initialized or set by the controller is ignored.
Tasks can be aborted by calling on the controller.
